summary: Calculate read counts per allele for allele-specific expression analysis
description:
This tool calculates allele counts at a set of positions after applying filters that are tuned for enabling allele-specific expression (ASE) analysis. The filters operate on mapping quality, base quality, depth of coverage, overlapping paired reads and deletions overlapping the position. All thresholds and options are controlled by command-line arguments.

Input

  • BAM files (with proper headers) to be analyzed for ASE
  • A VCF file with specific sites to process.

Output

A table of allele counts at the given sites. By default, it is formatted as a tab-delimited text file that is readable by R and compatible with Mamba, a downstream tool developed for allele-specific expression analysis.

Usage example

 java -jar GenomeAnalysisTK.jar \
   -R reference.fasta \
   -T ASEReadCounter \
   -o file_name.csv \
   -I input.bam \
   -sites sites.vcf \
   -U ALLOW_N_CIGAR_READS \
   [-minDepth 10] \
   [--minMappingQuality 10] \
   [--minBaseQuality 2] \
   [-drf DuplicateRead]

Note

  • Like most GATK tools, this tools filters out duplicate reads by default. However, some ASE methods recommend including duplicate reads in the analysis, so the DuplicateRead filter can be disabled using the "-drf DuplicateRead" flag in the command-line.

Caveat

  • This tool will only process biallelic sites. If your callset contains multiallelic sites, they will be ignored. Optionally, you can subset your callset to just biallelic variants using e.g. SelectVariants with the option "-restrictAllelesTo BIALLELIC".
name: ASEReadCounter

arguments.summary: Handling of overlapping reads from the same fragment
arguments.fulltext:
These options modify how the tool deals with overlapping read pairs.
 COUNT_READS -  Count all reads independently, even if they are from the same fragment.
 COUNT_FRAGMENTS - Count all fragments, even if the reads that compose the fragment are not consistent at that base.
 COUNT_FRAGMENTS_REQUIRE_SAME_BASE - Count all fragments, but only if the reads that compose the fragment are consistent at that base (default).
arguments.name: --countOverlapReadsType

options.name: COUNT_READS
options.summary: Count all reads independently (even if from the same fragment).

options.name: COUNT_FRAGMENTS
options.summary: Count all fragments (even if the reads that compose the fragment are not consistent at that base).

options.name: COUNT_FRAGMENTS_REQUIRE_SAME_BASE
options.summary: Count all fragments (but only if the reads that compose the fragment are consistent at that base).

arguments.summary: Ignore sites consisting only of deletions
arguments.name: --ignoreDeletionSites

arguments.fulltext: Consider a spanning deletion as contributing to coverage. Also enables deletion counts in per-base output.
arguments.name: --includeDeletions

arguments.fulltext:
If this argument is enabled, bases with quality scores lower than this threshold will not be counted.
 This is set to -1 by default to disable the evaluation and ignore this threshold.
arguments.name: --minBaseQuality

arguments.summary: Minimum number of bases that pass filters
arguments.fulltext:
If this argument is enabled, loci with total depth lower than this threshold after all filters have been applied
 will be skipped. This is set to -1 by default to disable the evaluation and ignore this threshold.
arguments.name: --minDepthOfNonFilteredBase

arguments.fulltext:
If this argument is enabled, reads with mapping quality values lower than this threshold will not be counted.
 This is set to -1 by default to disable the evaluation and ignore this threshold.
arguments.name: --minMappingQuality

arguments.summary: An output file created by the walker.  Will overwrite contents if file exists
arguments.name: --out

arguments.summary: Format of the output file, can be CSV, TABLE, RTABLE
arguments.fulltext: Available options are csv, table, rtable. By default, the format is an r-readable table.
arguments.name: --outputFormat
